metadata.description: This is the allowance you will be paid daily - expressed with the final two digits representing pence after the decimal point.
This is the total that you need left in your account for bills - expressed with the final two digits representing pence after the decimal point.
This is your monzo account ID, found in the developer portal.
This is the pot ID for your savings - any money that is to be set aside at the start and end of each month.
This is the pot ID for your operating income - the pot your daily allowance is paid from.
This is the oauth client secret created in the Monzo developer portal.

OperatingIncomeAmount.description: Should probably be moved (along with multiplier) out of config

uiDefinition.description: Your access token from the Monzo developer portal.

get.description: Retrieve information about an account’s balance.
To get information about an access token, you can call the /ping/whoami endpoint.

put.description: Move money from an account owned by the currently authorised user into one of their pots.

default.description: A unique string used to de-duplicate deposits. Ensure this remains static between retries to ensure only one deposit is created.

get.description: Returns a list of transactions on the user’s account.
Returns a list of pots owned by the currently authorised user.

put.description: Move money from a pot owned by the currently authorised user into one of their accounts.

default.description: A unique string used to de-duplicate deposits. Ensure this remains static between retries to ensure only one deposit is created.

post.description: Creates a new feed item on the user’s feed. These can be dismissed.

default.description: The refresh token received along with the original access token.
